website_summaries.verdict: A larger head support pillow that maximizes comfort for long durations and sleep periods.
pros: Different sizes for both adults and children so whole families can enjoy a comfortable sleep while flying
Pillow stows away when not in use to maximize limited room on an airplane
cons: Some find the pillow to be awkward at first, requiring a bit of adjustment

customer_reviews.title: Does what is says but needs to be better made for the price
customer_reviews.text: I researched this pillow and others for a long vacation to Italy. After researching I bought the BCOZZY pillow. It does what it says. It provides support for both sides of my head if I lean one way or another. I would've liked a velcro between the front two overlapping pieces to make it secure so it didn't unfold. It stayed pretty well without it but an added 1" of velcro would really seal it up tight. The reason for the 3 stars is that the strap to secure it to your backpack during travel broke after 1 use! That is poor quality and I think it should've lasted a lot longer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best Support
customer_reviews.text: My wife has Parkinson's and has trouble holding her head up. We tried other products, but this is the one that gave her the support she needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ibnweb25

customer_reviews.title: Better for sitting on.
customer_reviews.text: I did not find this supportive enough. The bolster is not large enough. I felt that my head was still reaching to make contact with the pillow. The passenger next to me had the original c-shaped style pillow. It looked to be about twice as thick in diameter to my pillow. Sorry I really wanted to like this.
customer_reviews.author: dizzy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not good for long necks. I'm 6'5 and probably would need three of these to start feeling any support.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie C.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this zero stars. It's very small and very thin. Maybe if they used magnets to keep the sides together it would work better but it just comes unwrapped. I will be returning it
customer_reviews.author: S. Carns

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I use this pillow with the double arms in back to lift my head and prevent me from compressing my vertebrae in my neck. I wear the pillow around the house and when I sit at my computer. I don't travel. It prevents me from compressing my neck vertebrae by forcing me to keep my chin down since I have the two arms crossed in back. My doctor suggested that I make an effort to keep my chin down due to osteoarthritis. I would give it a 5 if it had some way of preventing it from loosening. Maybe Velcro between the two arms?
customer_reviews.author: God Bless US

customer_reviews.title: ... the design would allow for multiple options of getting comfortable. I still did not get the needed support ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for an international flight thinking the design would allow for multiple options of getting comfortable. I still did not get the needed support to get totally comfortable and fall asleep. Plus it got pretty hot after awhile. I think a normal travel pillow at 1/3 price would have been just as good. I did like that it had a loop with a snap to hang it from luggage. But over all, not worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly J Henderson

customer_reviews.title: And its actually pretty comfy, but the quality is not really
customer_reviews.text: Its first time I have chance to use it for the trip, And its actually pretty comfy, but the quality is not really, the stitch is pop up so easily.
customer_reviews.author: kingston_hao

customer_reviews.title: Very disgusted by the product I received.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this product today and felt that I must write a review. Personal hygiene aside, I received a very obviously used pillow. I attached pictures of how it arrived. With the tag torn off and covered in cat or dog hair. I am highly allergic to cats and dogs. When I am purchasing an object I do expect some level of quality. I do not think I would purchase again due to the fact that I am concerned with the lack of quality control here. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews and articles on several travel pillows, my sister and I both purchased this for an international trip that included 20 hours of flight time each way. And we never regretted it once! Worth every single penny. Absolutely loved being able to twist and rotate it into several positions. My favorite was from folding it in half and laying on it while sleeping on my sister’s shoulder. We both wore/used it the entire time on each of our flights. I also loved the strap it has that you can use to attach it to your luggage. I traveled with a backpack and just snapped it onto the handle- easy!
customer_reviews.author: BethBotsfordGraham

customer_reviews.title: Finally a travel pillow that works!
customer_reviews.text: Until now I haven't found a travel pillow that works. Ordered the BCozzy and received the day I was the leave for a trip to China. This 16 hour flight was sure to test the BCozzy. I wasn't expecting it to work but it was pretty awesome, it gives you neck support and that much needed chin support. Nothing sucks worse that waking up with your head hanging forward with a sore neck. The BCozzy also seems smaller than most bulky travel pillows so I can easily fit in my luggage.
customer_reviews.author: curtis christensen

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Weird thing, I found that when I awaked my lips were hurting from my teeth being pressed into them by the pillow. I really didny like that. My neck didnt hurt though, which is good. I also think that this pillow is a little too small and should be thicker for even more support. May be good for small people and children
customer_reviews.author: Grey Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Material is not strong enough to hold up after washing.
customer_reviews.text: Liked it at first, then it started hurting me behind my neck. I spoke with a rep several times and they finally offered me a 30% off a larger one and told me to return this one to Amazon. I was going to but I wanted to wash this one because I had used it and after getting it out of a gentle wash it had a rip in the material. I feel if I return it Amazon will not accept it so I am stuck with it. I sewed it up the best I could and it is useable but still hurts my neck when I use it too often.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie

customer_reviews.title: Totally useless
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PILLOW! Listen to the negative reviews on this one— I wish I did. This pillow is dollar store quality, and actually made it harder for me to rest on the plane. It provides absolutely no head support in any direction. I finally was able to relax when I abandoned the pillow and put it under the seat in front of me. Trust the negative reviews on this one. It was so useless that I threw it away for the return trip— my suitcase was full enough, and it was not worth the room it would take up.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen F.

customer_reviews.title: Decent pillow but too pricey
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice pillow but it by no means is a magic pillow that'll snooze you to sleep. I did like how you could fold it in half to lay to one side and how it fit underneath your chin. But I used this one on two 10 hour flights and two 6 hour flights and still had instances with my head dropping forward even after having the pillow turned whichever way possible. It's also nice that the back of the pillow isn't bulky and pushing your head forward when sitting straight up. I don't think I'd buy this again because of the price, I may go back to the traditional neck pillows after this one.
customer_reviews.author: HT

customer_reviews.title: End of head flopping
customer_reviews.text: I cannot sleep on a plane. The problem for me it my head flops forward. I don't need or want anything *behind* my neck. This pillow design seemed promising. I tried it, and the results are good. My head didn't flop forward. And by arranging it tightly around my neck, I also didn't need to lean my head against anything--the pillow just held my head in place. To be fair, aircraft now have adjustable wings on the headrest that also help keep my head in place. But, all told, I think this is a winner. I slept, finally.
customer_reviews.author: Perpetual Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is so much better than the traditional neck pillows. I travel all the time, and with the different positions you're able to achieve by folding this pillow so many ways, I can actually get a pretty comfortable nap on the plane! I was hesitant to buy at first because it is a lot more expensive than other neck pillows on the market, but after using it on several flights now I COMPLETELY think it's worth the price. My un-stiff neck would agree. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Used it in the last animal transport and shared it with a lady that for some reason refuses to recline her seat back, so she's always flopping around, twitching and jerking while I'm driving. So I had her use this and with the extra support, wasn't doing all the swaying forward and she said her neck didn't hurt as much as it usually did when she woke up. I didn't use it so much this time, because I actually DO like to recline when it's my turn to sleep. But I messed around with it when I was the passenger and awake and while reading for a bit. It seemed comfortable and relieved some of the neck strain.
customer_reviews.author: Night Owl

customer_reviews.title: Wraparound design doesn't work and results in flopping around
customer_reviews.text: This design absolutely doesn't work for me. The pillow doesn't stay shut/secure in the front and effectively flops around rather than providing structured support. I lost an entire night of sleep attempting to get comfortable with this on an overnight flight. n.b. I have no problems with the quality of the product, only with the design-- just thought it worth sharing my experience with others who might be on the fence about whether this wraparound design would work for them.
customer_reviews.author: E Rose

customer_reviews.title: Contoured Design is Key
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long to get this? I've had other neck pillows that feel like they are choking me or are so thick your head is thrusted forward and you are totally uncomfortable. This one has a contoured design to adjust to your desired comfort. It is thinner in the back so your head isn't tilted forward. Isn't just for travel--I use it everyday at home in my comfy chair!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Behling

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very flexible to use in various configurations
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife who has advanced dementia and can no longer hold up her head. The flexibility to use this in several configurations is a clear advantage over many other products. Would like to see a version that doesn't get so hot on the neck (i.e., a different fabric option), but this is a great support pillow for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dieckmann

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect Neck Pillow
customer_reviews.text: The neck pillow is unique with it's twisted surround style shape. It's not too thick and is comfortable to wear. My one star complaint is the binding in the back where the snap is located is very narrow and provides no support to the neck. I found I had to twist my neck pillow to the side to feel any support on the back of my neck. I tried the double layer to rest my head against the window on a plane and found the doubled up option did not work for me at all. The extra twist in the front was okay but almost a little too much in the front.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P

customer_reviews.title: My favorite travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: I have bought previous travel pillows that were supposedly the best and while they were comfortable, my head always fell forward (even with the clips). This one completely solved the head falling forward issue and was the perfect height. The back is thin enough where it still feels comfortable when you lay back. Definitely my new favorite travel pillow. Wish there were a way to clip the front two ends so they move less. But overall they stay well. Haven't washed yet but will update when I do.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely useless. Does not provide any support unless you wrap it very tight around your neck. My neck is 14” and short. When my chin is supported I feel I am suffocating but when you loosen the pillow it just hangs down on your neck. I tried all suggested ways of using it but no luck. What is all the hype about? Are those positive reviews even real?
customer_reviews.author: Elena M.

customer_reviews.title: ... many positive reviews because I don’t find it very useful for me
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this product has so many positive reviews because I don’t find it very useful for me. For starters, there isn’t any support on the sides; which is important for me as I hate to nod from side to side. This product is only ok if you keep repositioning and keep it in the “choke” position which prevents the forward lean. If you have a larger neck, wrapping the pillow around completely will be difficult. The pillow also retains heat and can make you feel warm. I’m probably going to give it to a relative or keep it in the closet as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: E. Horta

customer_reviews.title: Best Trip Pillow ever
customer_reviews.text: Man, this is my first ever neck pillow and I used it on a 24 hour bus ride. I slept like a baby! if I could rate it 10 stars I would. Perfect chin support & it was well worth the money I told all my friends about it and hopefully they purchase one. The only thing I would recommend is probably a little sleeve to put it in while its not in use but other than that I highly recommend it. Im gonna put it in its first wash this weekend, so hopefully it holds up but with this type of quality I wouldn't be surprised. Thank you for this wonderful product
customer_reviews.author: Shameka

customer_reviews.title: I'm hopeful I received the child size in error
customer_reviews.text: I have traveled twice since I received your chin support travel pillow. I can not get comfortable with it at all. I tried everything; when I double up on the chin, it seems to be too short (it seems to choke my neck),; placing it loosely around my neck doesn't give me any support at all because the circumference is too small and folding it in half and resting it on my side is too thick. Even worse, I washed it upon receipt, and it itches badly unless I put my jacket between me and the pillow. I am very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Doris Lee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I bought the inflatable one and it worked pretty well on my long 14 hour plane trips. I'm a side sleeper so I put the stacked part on the side (instead of in front) and used a plane pillow to lean my head on and I slept for 6-8 hours straight on the plane. Pros: very comfortable and supportive, slept easily. Cons: the Velcro holding it together isn't very strong and would often come apart while I slept. However, that may have been because I have long hair that kept the Velcro from properly sticking together the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Saekit

customer_reviews.title: Soft and cushy but doesn't work on planes
customer_reviews.text: Since plane seats have headrests that jut forward any neck pillow really doesn't work. I probably tried 100 different positions with this pillow but couldn't find a comfortable position and even felt strangled. I used it instead in the middle of my back. Only good thing its really soft feeling. Not enough ergonomic design in it to support me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K

customer_reviews.title: I chose the BCOZZY after reading all the great reviews for other happy purchasers
customer_reviews.text: I chose the BCOZZY after reading all the great reviews for other happy purchasers. It was either the BCOZZY or another travel support pillow. I liked the design of the BCOZZY and the easy way it travels and connects to my carry on. We are planning a trip to Peru with an overnight flight so I wanted a travel pillow with comfort, easy storage, chin support and flexibility. Also, it was mentioned that I could use my noise canceling headphones. The travel memory foam pillow I currently have does not allow me to use my headphones comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: jcmiltz

customer_reviews.title: Soft and cozy
customer_reviews.text: This chin support pillow is comfortable, soft and cozy. A great feature is the wrap around pillow arms. It is a perfect size for traveling and comes with a handy strap so you can easily attach it to a backpack or suitcase. The pillow provides sufficient neck support and fits well for most adults and children. So far we have only been able to use it sitting around the house and in the car. We look forward to using it on an airplane as soon as we can.
customer_reviews.author: LDoubleE

customer_reviews.title: I used the attached strap to strap to my backpack when I wasn't using it and that was useful. Tried the pillow in the several different positions ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it for international flight. It was just ok. I used the attached strap to strap to my backpack when I wasn't using it and that was useful. Tried the pillow in the several different positions they suggested and still couldn't find one that was comfortable enough to sleep in for more than 20-30 minutes. Can't justify the 3x cost compared to a traditional travel pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Nice soft cushion for your neck.
customer_reviews.text: I use it mainly while sitting in my chair working for long hours. Definitely helps. Also definitely helps you sleep comfortably on your couch if you are ever a person who falls asleep on the couch in front of the TV. I haven't traveled yet. You know, COVID. But I am sure it will be comfortable for long journeys. Would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sunad

customer_reviews.title: BCOZZY Chin Supporting Travel Pillow - works great and is versatile
customer_reviews.text: The BCOZZY Chin Supporting Travel Pillow works great and is versatile. You can 'fold' it into different configurations for different type of support - chin support, back of neck support, and can be used to support you head from side to side. Seems unique this way!
customer_reviews.author: harvey

customer_reviews.title: Better than the horseshoe shaped pillow
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't able to take the pillow for traveling yet, but I tried it at home several times and it's great! So far I was using the regular horseshoe shaped pillow and I always had issues with my head falling forward. I love that this pillow has a chin support and it holds my head well. I also like the soft plush material and a loop to attach it to my bag. I can't wait to take my pillow for a long flight!
customer_reviews.author: Katerina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Product
customer_reviews.text: Every now and then I find a product worth sharing with my Facebook community and I just did for "BCozzy." For those of you who may have cervical neck issues, this is a life saver. My husband and I are enjoying being pain free. We each have our own. Use it for additional neck support, especially while watching TV and if you doze off, your neck will be completely secure. You can also use it with your pillow. We're happy campers. And I just bought it for two of my sisters and their husbands and my grandkids. I cannot give this product enough accolades!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay in place
customer_reviews.text: Another failed attempt to find the perfect pillow. This one is very soft, nice on my skin, and could work if only it would stay in the “closed” position. The arms are supposed to cross over in front to support your chin, but they just flop open constantly. I was desperate to make it work before our trip, so I tried sewing Velcro tabs on the arms to hold them together, but that failed. Just the pressure of my head or chin resting on the pillow was too much for the slippery little arms. If the pillow had some kind of internal support (maybe a wire) to keep the arms in place, it might function better.
customer_reviews.author: Gaia Wild

customer_reviews.title: Amazing travel pillow that actually does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I have a million neck pillows, as I have a ridiculously hard time sleeping upright (ie long plane trips are miserable). So far, this has been the surprise favorite. The fabric effectively keeps the pillow in whatever place you put it, and it actually supports your head - no more head bobbing! My husband, who teases me about my struggle to find a good pillow, even liked it so much he asked me to order one for him. My second favorite is the NapAnywhere, which took a bit of trial and error but ended up supporting well and folds flat. Sadly, not sold on Amazon (though it should be!).
customer_reviews.author: abielle76

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to love this
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot of travel pillows before a long flight and settled on this one. I tried it on my 8 hour flight and didn't really like it. It didn't really support my chin and I had to keep readjusting and tightening it. I threw it away after the flight. NOTE- if you are a light sleeper, you might like this! I'm not though. I can barely sleep on a plane. I wanted something that would enable me to rest comfortably and fall asleep, but this wasn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the positive reviews and read the one star reviews. The one star reviews are correct. The neck support is too thin for average adult necks and the support material is very soft compared to more firmer material in other, less expensive neck pillows. I am returning this immediately to Amazon after just receiving it.
customer_reviews.author: guyinseattle1

customer_reviews.title: Intelligent design is priceless
customer_reviews.text: So i have 2 shoulder replacements and some cervical issues. Try not to sit in one position longer than 15 mins. I’ve tried literally every version for flying etc leaving me stunned by the ignorance of design until i purchased BCOZZY’s version. Neck pain is mostly a result of poor posture, ergonomics of work. Ur head is heavy so the ONLY design i recommend to fly with is this one. It’s long enough in the FRONT to overlap & keep ur head up. Stop wasting money on ignorant design & get this!!!
customer_reviews.author: desmond

customer_reviews.title: Look no further!!! Best Neck pillow on the market!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth bcozzy purchase over as many years. I have CP, which requires me to be in a power wheelchair 18+hrs/day, cervical stenosis, and chronic migraines. I have tried a zillion types of neck pillows. These have been a magical lifesaver! I have one in my office, car, bedroom, and this particular upgrade is AMAZING for what you need targeted head and neck support because of the customization features. Thanks for such an extraordinary product! I will be a bcozzy customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Mongiovi

customer_reviews.title: Great Support for Head and Neck
customer_reviews.text: Great support while sitting in my easy chair. Not really a pillow for sleeping or prone position, imo. But great support for your chin and neck in a chair.
customer_reviews.author: Faux Diva

customer_reviews.title: You dont know it but you need it
customer_reviews.text: I already had a travel pillow and was absolutely not looking to buy another one. However, I saw an advertisement of this pillow and read the rave reviews and wondered if it truly could the fix to getting a crick in my neck each time I fly. And since having tried it, I'm angry that all travel pillows dont have the same feature. The extra support makes a world of difference. Your head wont hang anymore and my neck feels sooo much better.
customer_reviews.author: Moen

customer_reviews.title: barely works, but has many flaws
customer_reviews.text: Classic hold, holds your chin up, but the ends doesn't stay put and slide around. Also, yes it holds your chin up, but as soon as your head tilts to the side, there's 0 support. The elevated side is useless. Literally doesn't work, your head tilts over so much that it's not really supporting much of anything. I feel strain on my neck. The double up works better than the elevated side, but still doesn't give enough support. I'm going to see if a friend wants this, if not, then I'll do a return. Smell isn't that bad, just let it air out. It seems soft and doesn't get to warm.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: It's better than a normal neck pillow. I suppose since I'm a small person, it may not have worked as well as I would have liked. To get it to hold my head up, I needed to wrap it tight either to one side or my chin. It really may be user error that it only fit well part of the time. It also ripped the first time I used it, but couldn't hardly notice that. It had to through numerous international flights. The actual fabric is very soft and the support is pretty good, especially if you just stick it on the tray table and use it as a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not enough support.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this item as I had never seen a chin supporting travelling pillow like this before. I put it on and felt like there wasn’t enough support for the neck, the pillow needs to be a bit thicker in my opinion. Next, I tried to mimic the head tilt positions that happen when you fall asleep on an airplane seat and I felt as if the “chin supporting arms” were choking me.
customer_reviews.author: TheTraveller

customer_reviews.title: Two pairs is better than one.
customer_reviews.text: This pillow has been on a couple of international trips and domestic connections, I haven’t seen too many compact and supportive travel pillows out there. We bring this guy on our road trips as well. I usually fold it and sleep with on one side, my mrs. like to have it around her neck. Well problem solve, we finally decidedvto second pair for our upcoming road trip to the national park, and my kids and mrs. likes to take nap while I do the driving.
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited waiting for this and once I tried it on, I was not disappointed!! It is nice that it can cover around of your neck so it fully gives you neck and chin support on the long flight/travels. I selected L size. Overall - Nice item and a must have. Good for travels. It has a little part you can tie with luggage too!!! Love this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vorakamol

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Pillow!
customer_reviews.text: While I haven't been traveling via air recently. I was able to use this great pillow on a 4 hour car ride. I had the middle seat and didn't have any way to lean my head over to take a nap. This pillow saved the day. It was comfortable, soft and supportive. It didn't make me too hot. I woke up form my nap ready to go with no neck pain or stiffness! Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Soft travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first travel pillow after reading great reviews. I agree this is a nice pillow. Someone commented a strong odour which I didn't smell a strong odour at all. I only tried it at home as I have not traveled anywhere since buying this pillow. But it seem to give great support for the neck and it will prevent your head from bouncing forward. I agree with another review that a button or velcro will prevent it from opening up and stay put. Overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Tushkush

customer_reviews.title: Yay! NOT Memory Foam!
customer_reviews.text: What's the deal with most neck pillows being memory foam these days? My husband likes some support, and left his last neck pillow somewhere on our last trip. He uses it at home all the time, too, so after watching the video on this, I decided to try it. HE LOVES IT! If you don't want a squishy memory foam neck pillow, and one with flexibility, you'll love this one!
customer_reviews.author: Everyday K

customer_reviews.title: Get large size if your above average height no stuff stack
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy $13.00 2.5LT sea to summit stuff bag to put it in should've got 3LT.I got the reg adult size it only barely fit had to keep making tight with fingers.I'm male with apparently long neck Caucasian.I wish they should've had more specific sizing instruction for males how to measure neck or shirt collar size.I did read reviews but I didn't pay close enough attention about getting large size.the reviews said the button strap kept ripping .so I got stuff sack.did not use enough on amtrak train only barely fit .it did work but kept have to tighten gnat tac-sea the caribeau is more highly rated but more expensive
customer_reviews.author: GNAT tac-sea

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: Product is perfect for lengthy plane flights. It's not your average neck pillow. The back part of the pillow is slightly small in girth to allow more head and neck comfort when resting on the headrest. There are a few ways to use the pillow that are dependent on what type of comfort you're looking for. I like how it nicely wraps around my neck. When sleeping, I don't have to worry about my head leaning into the next seat. The pillow will keep your neck and body more erect.
customer_reviews.author: L. Guillermo

customer_reviews.title: Great Pillow
customer_reviews.text: Best travel pillow I have found so far! It folds in so many ways to accommodate your seating and or sleep position. Soft and did not have an odor. Has a great strap to attache to your carry on bag handle to avoid taking up precious room. Slept for the entire 4.5 hour flight and didn't have a sore neck after.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Denis

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and support!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to use on long trips (as he transitions from his car seat into a booster seat) but all 3 of the kids took to it and now I see them wearing it while watching tv on the couch ! It is a nice soft material that provides the right amount of support. I like that it does not push your head forward - allows it to be in a neutral position. I also like how it can be folded in half... I now need to order more so the kids stop fighting over it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to find a nice pillow for my next travel that was not big as usually all the travel pillows are. I found this one and I’m glad that it fits perfectly around my neck and not bothering me as others pillows does. Even my baby fits, probably I’m going get one more for my baby. I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Nice neck pillow with a bit of extra support. It has a snap loop to hook it onto your bag for travelling and is as comfortable a neck pillow as any I have used. And the seller reached out to me directly to let me know that the product had shipped and provided a short video on how to get the most out of this product. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: NY Gal

customer_reviews.title: Good design and excellent comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kid (6 years old) for car travel, since he uses car seat, his head always falls front while sleeping. We tried this for short trip over the weekend and the round shape keeps his head in a place and makes him sleep comfortably. Good design compared to regular one.
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for short 2-5 hour flights but not Longer flights
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this neck pillow Read the reviews that led me to buy it I purchased the XL version for $10 more fir the past 60days I did 8 flights over 14 hours each and 10 between 2-5 hours each On the long flight I managed to sleep a good 7 hours and in all cases I ended up sweating needing to get the pillow washed after a round trip as a stiff or sour neck but on the up side on short flights It worked perfectly managed to sleep easy and no side effects
customer_reviews.author: Benhakman

customer_reviews.title: X-Large really is!
customer_reviews.text: I have neck problems that are aggravated by having to sit for long periods in cars and planes. I ordered both the regular and X-Large sizes and found the X-Large was really too large for me, in spite of being rather large myself. I haven't used this for long trips yet, but it has worked well on local drives. I also tested it out while sitting in bed reading. As often happens, I dozed off. The pillow did keep my head and chin comfortably supported without aggravating my neck.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil Ann Simmons

customer_reviews.title: So good I got two!
customer_reviews.text: I love this neck pillow so much I bought another one just to have for my boyfriend when he travels. I don’t need him burrowing mine lol. I will never be without it when I travel. Once I forgot it at my friend’s house and it was a very uncomfortable plane ride.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great to use  after nasal surgery!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I bought it to use after nasal surgery and put it on right away. It keeps my head from rolling forward during sleep and wake times. I am very pleased with this product, I have been wearing it everyday ( all day) after my surgery and it has been extremely helpful. I am a petite female and my neck is small; so, I'm not sure how comfortable it would be for a larger person, but it is not snug on me, it fits just right. Regardless, I would definitely recommend giving it a try. I also plan to use it for travel.
customer_reviews.author: MLT

customer_reviews.title: it’s alright...
customer_reviews.text: This pillow does indeed provide different ways for you to use it in different positions. However, I find that it doesn’t really hold up my head and provide enough neck support. It may help you be more comfortable while sitting on a plane or car, but personally, it did NOT help me fall asleep. I didn’t really find it any better than the normal travel pillows you find at the airport. My husband, who falls asleep easily ANYWHERE, ANYTIME did use this pillow. However, he doesn’t even need any type of pillow to fall asleep. I don’t think this pillow is worth the extra money. If you have difficulty falling asleep upright, this won’t help you.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this pillow. My issue is that it doesn't stay in place. The two sides slowly slide apart when your head is resting on it (like when it's wrapped around your neck). It was hard to get it to stay in place, unfortunately. If there was a better way to secure it when it's on, I'd absolutely love it. It's very comfortable before it starts slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Terra Tsuji

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I like this one because of that double hook that act as an extra layer of support for which ever side you sleep toward normally. Very comfortable and simple to use! Not much to say. But if you have a longer neck get the larger size just a little FYI.
customer_reviews.author: John Dinh

customer_reviews.title: Light/Comfy/Easy to Carry
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first but my head and neck are very pleased. Lol as am I. I sleep like a baby now that I don’t have to worry about my head bobbing about and when I wake up my neck isn’t sore. There are a few different ways you can wear this so whatever works for you but I personally stack the ends and swivel the whole thing beneath my left ear, let my head rest there and I’m out! I sleep on my left side naturally so this is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: Slim and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for my daughter who usually falls asleep on long travels. Shipping was very fast with Amazon. Not only it supports the chin well but you can turn it to any position you like for support. I decided to give it a try in taking nap in my rocking chair and didn't feel any weight on the shoulders. It also seems less bulky and easy to carry in a backpack. Will wait for air travel reopen and giving it a try and order more for each one in the family.
customer_reviews.author: Natekar P.

customer_reviews.title: Great chin support but lacks overall head support
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this travel pillow so badly. I spent hours researching travel pillows and settled on Bcozzy because of the unique chin support. I have trouble sleeping on planes and when I do manage to fall asleep I have bobble head and usually nod forward. Bcozzy does a great job cradling the chin and is low enough on the sides that I can comfortably wear my noise cancelling headphones. However I did that if I lean my head to either side I lack head support and cannot get comfortable. This product is great if you only plan to sleep with your head leaning.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: A Cozzy pillow to lean on 👍
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when i received my pillow last week and tried it right away! It fits really well providing support around my neck while I’m doing my office work with my business sitting there for an extended period of time and it’s adjustable I can just easily take it off when I needed a break. I’m loving it and can’t wait to use it on our upcoming long drive this coming weekend. Also, my teenage daughter is loving it. I might try get another one.
customer_reviews.author: L Chozee

customer_reviews.title: Superior comfort
customer_reviews.text: The pillow was super flexible and comfortable from the moment I wore it. Unlike other travel pillows this one was not stiff at all which gives my neck some movement and does not restrict me to a particular angle. I love the chin support it’s absolutely helpful for the neck and I use it while working, gaming and travelling. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Mohit Bathija

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable Travel Pillow
customer_reviews.text: The design is so good that it curls around your neck- Soft and Cozy. I have been using this for few of my car long travels and used it for a long flight to the west coast., Loving it so far. The comfort is amazing and so far have seen no issues. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Krishna Chaitanya

customer_reviews.title: Nice Design!
customer_reviews.text: This design is an very ingenious. You can fold the pillow in a specific manner to support you desire. I really liked it. I travel quiet often and usually fly to different states for service calls and this pillow come handy in flight or while taking a quick nap.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not Supportive for Adults
customer_reviews.text: For a $30 pillow you'd expect a bit more pillow than what you actually get. The "thick" areas were not even as thick as a normal neck pillow. Wrapping the thick area around and doubling it up is not supportive enough for an adult's head, folding it just slid off everything, and wrapping it tighter to get more support led to choking. The fill material was nice, but the geometry of this pillow is awful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent neck pillow, not amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting an amazing experience with this pillow. Used it on a 12-hour non-stop red eye flight to Europe. It was more comfortable than a blow-up pillow, but I still was not able to sleep with it. The fabric is very soft, the stuffing is substantial, it conveniently snapped on to my luggage. However, when in use, my neck still felt twisted and uncomfortable and in the end I didn't get a wink of sleep. I will probably continue to use it until the next best thing comes along.
customer_reviews.author: Cassiopea

customer_reviews.title: Good support and adjustable fit
customer_reviews.text: Nice travel pillow, provides good support to the neck and is adjustable. I use this to lay flat on my back without any other pillow so as to help with my posture twice a week for 1 hour. A little pricy but the make and fit is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SBarr

customer_reviews.title: Best neck pillow I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before a trip to Disney which required both bus and air travel. It is by far the BEST neck pillow I have ever owned. I have fibromyalgia, so travel is particularly tough on my body, especially my neck and shoulders. This pillow saved me from so much of the usual fatigue and pain. It is versatile, longer than most pillows, and can be adjusted to support whatever area of your neck needs the most support, plus it has a snap on strap that attaches to carry on luggage. I am eternally grateful to whomever designed this pillow! Truly a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S. L. Sochoka

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay in place!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow because I knew that I was getting on a flight immediately following a 12 hour night shift as a nurse and I would NEED some sleep! The reviews were great so I bought it right away. I'm a 20 something female with an average build and this pillow would NOT stay in place at all. Maybe because I have a small/average size neck? I tried all the ways shown- ends under my chin, ends sideways, folding it up and leaning against the window, making it so tight I could hardly breathe- nothing kept it in place! I am extremely disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Cohara

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but needs work
customer_reviews.text: At first glance this is a good idea but after traveling 8 hours on a plane and having to adjust it every two seconds because it wouldn’t stay supporting your head in the front, then it becomes a bad idea. I must say the back part of the pillow is flat enough that doesn’t tilt your head forward and with enough support, but in the front it should have a button so it holds up your head the entire time without you having to hold it.
customer_reviews.author: A martinez

customer_reviews.title: Sleepy time! Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these...2 as gifts. These are a game changer! I used to hate neck pillows because of my head falling forward. Put this puppy on with some eye covers, noise cancelling headphones, and you're out The whole flight. So easy to travel with because you can clip it to your backpack or carry-on. I've washed mine and it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Raluca

customer_reviews.title: Best neck pillow for head bobbers!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can sleep pretty much anywhere, including planes, but I constantly head bob and get a sore neck while traveling. After doing some research on neck pillow, I realized that I needed one that would support my chin. I purchased this neck pillow for my first international flight (9 hour flight and then a connecting 4 hour flight) and I slept like a baby--4 hours straight! No sore neck. This neck pillow is amazing and a must buy! Do not waste your money on a basic neck pillow that will not support your chin!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: The best neck pillow.
customer_reviews.text: The best neck pillow for traveling I've ordered in a long time, and I have purchased four some with music, gel, beans etc. I love the double fold to keep my head up from Bobbing forward Lol. Really worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: GlenB

customer_reviews.title: Neck saver
customer_reviews.text: I travel internationally for work. My most recent flight was from Boston to Asia. This neck pillow worked great. The flat back allows your head to sit against headrest while the adjustable wrap around allows you to provide various levels of support. I slept like a baby. We also drive a ton for work in Asia. I keep this pillow in the rental van. My colleagues always give me a hard time and make me ride in the back because I'm always the first to fall asleep. They've posted a ton of pictures on instagram of me out cold.
customer_reviews.author: Muad'Dib

customer_reviews.title: I love this pillow
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot. I have over 8 travel pillows and this is my favorite. It is soft with great support for sleeping or waking hours. I have decided to give all the other travel pillows away and purchase 2 or 3 more of these.
customer_reviews.author: wiseman07

customer_reviews.title: So much more than I thought.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I feel like the description doesn’t do it justice. I was worried it would be too warm to use, but I was pleasantly surprised that it was not. It is very comfortable and has three ways you can use it. I bought it for my upcoming flight, but I used it to watch tv in bed and it was great! Give it a whirl!!! You won’t be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable and good quality
customer_reviews.text: After trying several, this is the one I kept. It can be adjusted to fit your needs by providing a small or large amount of support. You can use it to prop up your chin as shown or not. Soft good quality material on the outside with enough support. What I like the most is the fact that you can adjust it for several positions. It is not as thick as it appears in the photo but is perfect for the amount of support I was looking for. It does not push your head forward like some of the others because the bulky portion can go in the front, back, or side.
customer_reviews.author: ANN

customer_reviews.title: Great neck support
customer_reviews.text: I usually take a nap in my car on my lunch break at work, the BCOZZY travel pillow is perfect for that! I love how it supports my neck and chin so I don't have to tilt my head to the side all the time, I can let it drop to the front without getting any cramps in my neck. It's also very comfy when I do want to tilt my head to either side
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable neck support!
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I got this product, I have been using it while I work. It's really comfortable around my neck and provides both support and warmth. It doesn't have a strong smell too, which I really like. It's definitely helped improve my work from home experience thus far. Hoping to use it for travel one day!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Wang

customer_reviews.title: This pillow is great for home.
customer_reviews.text: Working from home since the onset of COVID-19 prompted me to get a neck pillow for home. I looked at about 20 neck pillows and ended up getting myself, my mom and boyfriend a BCOZZY neck pillow. My 76-year-old mom loves it. She takes the pillow from her recliner to her bed. Not only are we all finding it very comfortable the customer service from BCOZZY is outstanding. They go over and beyond to make sure you are satisfied with your purchase and it is very warm and soft. This BCOZZY is way more than a travel pillow. It is great for the home.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeisha M. Gandy

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for long flights to Asia
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for flight to and from Thailand from Boston and am really happy with my decision. Some of the legs were 10-12 hours and I slept comfortably much of the way because of the Bcozzy. I like that you can use in several different positions. The neck support is great. It is soft, has no weird odor (like a different memory foam travel neck pillow my husband had for the flight), does not make you feel overheated, and folds in half easily to stuff in my knapsack. The snap feature was convenient when I wanted to tote on my luggage or hang up by my airplane table. And it's an adorable color.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brundige

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable supporting pillow
customer_reviews.text: Really like this pillow. I like the support it gives for my neck and chin . It is soft and comfortable and holds its shape! Because it is adjustable you can customize, to exactly your neck size. Really good pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Theo K.

customer_reviews.title: Great travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: I like how this travel pillow allows you to change the position for different types of support. I didn't feel like my chin was COMPLETELY supported, as in my muscles were still engaged, holding my head up, but it is definitely better than other pillows that don't wrap under the chin. I especially like how you can double the pillow and use it. This is an awesome feature. Kept my neck warm in the plane. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Baker

customer_reviews.title: Leaves you hanging
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow for a long flight from London to the US. On that flight it was useless. The velcro didn't hold, thus it didn't support my head. And I had 10 plus hours to adjust it. Every time I got cozy it popped loose and my head fell over. It was worthless! Do not buy! I bought it early and my trip lasted a month so I can't get a refund but I'm trashing it. If I could give it a 0 on everything but traveling, I would; but it does fold flat. 😖
customer_reviews.author: Shan Rhea

customer_reviews.title: Worth the bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This is the beat neck pillow for air plan travel over 24hrs. Here is why. It’s great for support under your chin and keeping your head up right. You can fold it to sleep on it side ways. It’s was well worth the investment. And comfy!
customer_reviews.author: Celsei

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable pillow. The one I had before had the same thikness in front and on a back making my head uncomfortable as it was not touching the seat on the airplane. This one has different thicknesses and works good for long flights.
customer_reviews.author: Kelcey Baten

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money - Your Head Will Thank You
customer_reviews.text: Each time I take the red-eye, I arrive tired & miserable because I could not sleep. Ordered the Bcozzy pillow after some research. Just used it on a flight to Spain. The pillow made a huge difference. I didn’t want to spend $33, especially when you see others for $10, but those others don’t work. This kept my head from bobbing up & down & I wasn’t leaning my head against the tray. A fellow passenger did & it looked awful. Nothing beats sleeping in 1st class but for us poorer folks this Bcozzy pillow helps. Nice clip to use so you don’t have to pack it.
customer_reviews.author: MariaG

customer_reviews.title: Way better than the other ones!
customer_reviews.text: OK, I tried this out on a window seat flight, and used all the possible positions of the "arms." OMG, what everyone says. I fell fast asleep and my mouth did not drop open and my neck did not hurt. I think a reason I slept so well is that I was not worrying about either of those things happening...and people staring at me!
customer_reviews.author: Foodie

customer_reviews.title: Best Neck Pillow on Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this is my favorite neck pillow. I had a Chiari decompression in July and I ordered this right after. The "brace" they gave me at the hospital pulled my hair because of the Velcro. I love that I can even use this "backward." My neck mobility was very restricted at one point at the surgery and this helped my neck rest when I was out and about or trying to do something of that sort. Best Neck Pillow on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Adkins

customer_reviews.title: comformatble neck pillow
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure on how this would work for neck support but I was not comformatable with regular ne k pillows, so I decided to go ahead with this after reading its good reviews. And after using it for few days I can see thst my neck gets adjuststed very well with this. Also as the inclination is prefect there is no pain in neck after its use for almost 2 hours too.
customer_reviews.author: Darshan

customer_reviews.title: Ordered for 20+hour flight
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty comfortable and very convenient to attach to my carry-on backpack for my flight to Romania on a study abroad trip. It did not fully hold my head up, my neck was still a little bent when using. After a few hours I needed to rearrange this so my head tilted towards the opposite side., otherwise my neck would be a little sore. Overall I liked the support this gave me while on the plane, and it was small enough to not be in other people's way.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Furlough
